meanings.definition: The act of establishing or bringing back into existence an institution, especially a mental health institution.
meanings.sent1: The reinstitutionalization of mental health facilities is a topic of debate in our community.
meanings.sent2: After the closure of many mental health institutions, there was a push for reinstitutionalization.
meanings.sent3: The reinstitutionalization of the old library as a community center brought new life to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for history led to the reinstitutionalization of the local museum, preserving its artifacts for future generations.
meanings.sent5: The reinstitutionalization of the school's art program sparked creativity in the students.

meanings.definition: The process of reintroducing individuals into an institutional setting, often after being released from a previous institution.
meanings.sent1: Reinstitutionalization can sometimes be challenging for individuals transitioning from one facility to another.
meanings.sent2: The reinstitutionalization of patients after their discharge requires careful planning and support.
meanings.sent3: The reinstitutionalization of the penguins back into their exhibit was a sight to behold at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her return to the university felt like a reinstitutionalization into the world of academia.
meanings.sent5: The reinstitutionalization of the elderly into nursing homes can be a difficult adjustment for some.
